column4: Ubuntu is the first OS that has hung on me in the past 10 years. Yes, my question is what do I do so that ubuntu doesn't hang
I suppose the only thing I can do is not use ubuntu
And it doesn't even hang once and then nothing. It hangs periodically - about once a day or so...
define "hang"
doesn't work. Is that good enough. Mouse pointer stops moving, computer is not responding. I believe it's a memory leak...one of many
can you get to a tty?
non-responsive means I can't do anything incl. tty
what video driver are you using?
the same I'm using in fedora, debian and they don't hang

this isn't a proper answer...  If you want help, try to answer questions.  If you just want to waste people's time and whine, then just use a different distro.  Use what works for you instead of wasting people's time
I'm using r506 which is for ati X1400
what does "no dough" mean?
and why do you want this package?
does it matter why I want the package? I need it for development obviously :\
yes, I ask because often people ask because they are compiling a package in the repositories and are not aware of APT. I just wanted to rule that out
yeah. I'm using aptitude but for some reason curl-config --cflags shows nothing (it's supposed to show where the headers are)
I think I found it. Strange the curl-config is broken I think. IT's supposed to show /usr/include/curl/
right, I was going to say that installing the -dev package you mentioned earlier should drop the files in /usr/include/curl
note that pkg-config --libs libcurl also returns an empty line
sorry, I meant pkg-config --cflags libcurl
hmm
I have never use libcurl.  You are certain there needs to be something returned here?
my guess is this blank output is ok as gcc should check /usr/include/ by default, no?
